intro: Staurogyne elmeri, commonly known as the Elmer's starwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Hydrocharitaceae, which includes aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its submerged or floating leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats such as ponds and lakes. Staurogyne elmeri is often used in aquariums due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in controlled environments.
